title: Machine Learning-Based Instructional Design for Mobile Learning Taxonomy

context.prior_knowledge: Basic Digital Device Usage Skills and Foundational Language Learning Competencies
context.additional_context: Asynchronous learning activities conducted using learners' personal mobile devices or institution-provided digital equipment

learning_goals: Learners can classify the cognitive demand levels (e.g., understanding/applying/analyzing) of learning design texts with 85% accuracy.
Learners can identify inquiry-based learning designs (reflecting stages such as problem definition, hypothesis formulation, and experiment design) with 80% accuracy.
Learners can evaluate the role of situational context (e.g., fieldwork integration, virtual environment utilization) in learning design with 75% accuracy.
Learners can compare classification results and interpretability of machine learning models to select one suitable for instructional design.
difficulty: Hard - Complex requirements with multiple constraints
